descr.p: This unit provides TTextWriter, a concrete implementation of TFormattingWriter that generates plain text output with line wrapping.

The writer supports configurable line length, automatic text wrapping at word boundaries, headers with underlines, ASCII-formatted tables, lists with bullets and numbering, preformatted text blocks, and clean plain text output suitable for email or console display.

element.name: TTextWriter
element.short: Plain text output writer with line wrapping and formatting support

descr.p: TTextWriter generates plain text output from formatted content.

The writer supports automatic line wrapping at configurable line lengths, headers with underline characters (= for level 0-1, - for level 2+), ASCII-formatted tables with borders and column alignment, lists with numbered or bullet formatting, and preformatted text blocks with indentation.
Text formatting is rendered using asterisks for bold (*text*), underscores for italic and underline (_text_).

element.name: TTextWriter.Create
element.short: Creates a new text writer instance

descr.p: Creates a new TTextWriter instance that writes to the specified stream.
The constructor initializes MaxLineLength to 72 characters (standard email width) and sets up internal buffers for line wrapping and table formatting.

element.name: TTextWriter.Create.AStream
element.short: Output stream for the generated text

descr.p: Destroys the TTextWriter instance and flushes any remaining content to the output stream.
Plain text output requires no character escaping.
EscapeText returns the input text without modification.
Begins document generation and writes the document title if provided.
The title is underlined with equals signs (=) and followed by a blank line.
Finishes document generation and flushes any remaining content to the output stream.
Starts a header section at the specified level.
Headers are rendered with underline characters after HeaderEnd is called.
Completes the header section and adds an underline below the header text.
Level 0-1 headers use equals signs (=), level 2+ headers use dashes (-).
The underline length matches the header text length.
Starts a new paragraph by flushing any current line content.
Completes the current paragraph and adds a blank line for separation.
Forces a line break by flushing the current line to output.
Writes a horizontal rule using dashes (-) across the full line width.
The rule length equals MaxLineLength.
Begins bold text formatting by writing an asterisk (*).
Ends bold text formatting by writing an asterisk (*).
Begins italic text formatting by writing an underscore (_).
Ends italic text formatting by writing an underscore (_).
Begins underline text formatting by writing an underscore (_).
Ends underline text formatting by writing an underscore (_).
Begins a preformatted text section with 4-space indentation.
Preformatted text preserves whitespace and is indented from the left margin.
Ends the preformatted text section and removes the 4-space indentation.

element.name: TTextWriter.TableStart
element.short: Begins ASCII table with specified columns

descr.p: Begins an ASCII-formatted table with the specified number of columns.
Table cells are separated with vertical bars (|) and header rows are underlined with dashes.

element.name: TTextWriter.TableStart.NoCols
element.short: Number of columns in the table

descr.p: Completes the table and adds blank lines for separation.
Begins a new table row and clears the cell buffer.
Completes the current table row and formats it with borders and padding.
The first row is treated as a header and followed by a separator line.
Begins a new table cell.
Cell content is captured through subsequent Write calls.
Completes the current table cell and stores its content for row formatting.
Begins a table header cell.
Header cells are formatted identically to regular cells but determine column widths.
Completes the table header cell and stores its content for formatting.
Begins a list with the specified type and increases indentation by 4 spaces.
List items are formatted with numbers for ordered lists or bullets for unordered lists.
Completes the list and reduces indentation by 4 spaces.

element.name: TTextWriter.ListItemStart
element.short: Begins list item with numbering or bullet

descr.p: Begins a list item with appropriate numbering for ordered lists or bullet (*) for unordered lists.
Completes the current list item and flushes content to output.

element.name: TTextWriter.ListItem
element.short: Writes complete list item with text

descr.p: Writes a complete list item with the specified text.
This is a convenience method that calls ListItemStart, Write, and ListItemEnd in sequence.

element.name: TTextWriter.ListItem.AText
element.short: Text content of the list item

element.name: TTextWriter.DefinitionItem
element.short: Writes definition item with term and description

descr.p: Writes a definition item with the term name followed by its description on an indented line.
Writes text content with automatic line wrapping at word boundaries.
Text is wrapped to fit within MaxLineLength and respects current indentation levels.

element.name: TTextWriter.MaxLineLength
element.short: Maximum line length for text wrapping

descr.p: Maximum line length for automatic text wrapping.
Text longer than this limit is wrapped at word boundaries. Default value is 72 characters (standard email width).
